headline: Lyft Stock Sinks on Revenue Miss
summary: Lyft  missed analyst expectations on revenue but beat on earnings per share in the second quarter.  Earnings per share were 10 cents versus analyst expectations of four cents.  Lyft is already feeling the heat: Its shares fell nearly 4% Wednesday morning to around $14 a share, just two days after announcing a partnership with Chinese firm  Baidu  to deploy autonomous rides across Europe.

headline: Uber Posts Q2 Sales Beat, $20 Billion Buyback Plan. But Stock Falls Amid Robotaxi Debate.
summary: Uber Technologies met second-quarter earnings forecasts and beat revenue estimates while announcing a $20 billion stock buyback.  Uber said it earned an adjusted 63 cents per share for the June-ended quarter, up 34% from a year earlier.  Gross bookings value across Uber's rides and food-delivery business grew 17% to $46.76 billion for the quarter, exceeding estimates of $46.42 billion.

raw.headline: Uber Posts Q2 Sales Beat, $20 Billion Buyback Plan. But Stock Falls Amid Robotaxi Debate.
raw.summary: Uber Technologies met second-quarter earnings forecasts and beat revenue estimates while announcing a $20 billion stock buyback.  Uber said it earned an adjusted 63 cents per share for the June-ended quarter, up 34% from a year earlier.  Gross bookings value across Uber's rides and food-delivery business grew 17% to $46.76 billion for the quarter, exceeding estimates of $46.42 billion.

headline: Uber in talks with banks, private equity firms to fund robotaxi expansion
summary: (Reuters) -Uber is in talks with private equity firms and banks to secure funds to build its robotaxi business, CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said, as the ride-hailing giant bets on a mass roll-out of the nascent and much-scrutinized technology.  The company has been offering robotaxis from Alphabet-owned Waymo on its ride-hailing app in Austin and Atlanta.  Khosrowshahi on Wednesday pitched the tie-ups as part of a larger plan that involves three robotaxi business models: paying partners that own such vehicles a fixed rate, sharing revenue with fleet operators and owning vehicles while licensing software for self-driving technology.

raw.headline: Uber in talks with banks, private equity firms to fund robotaxi expansion
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Uber is in talks with private equity firms and banks to secure funds to build its robotaxi business, CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said, as the ride-hailing giant bets on a mass roll-out of the nascent and much-scrutinized technology.  The company has been offering robotaxis from Alphabet-owned Waymo on its ride-hailing app in Austin and Atlanta.  Khosrowshahi on Wednesday pitched the tie-ups as part of a larger plan that involves three robotaxi business models: paying partners that own such vehicles a fixed rate, sharing revenue with fleet operators and owning vehicles while licensing software for self-driving technology.

summary: Uber Technologies (NYSE: UBER) reported fiscal second-quarter 2025 results on Wednesday. The company reported a quarterly revenue growth of 18% year-on-year to $12.65 billion, beating the analyst consensus estimate of $12.46 billion. Uber reported adjusted EPS of 63 cents, which beat the analyst consensus estimate of 62 cents. Revenue from Mobility grew to $7.3 billion, up 19% Y/Y. headline: Uber Stock Gains After Earnings. It’s Brushing Off the Robo-Taxi Threat.
summary: Uber Technologies  stock was rising Wednesday.  The ride-hailing company’s better-than-expected earnings and a $20 billion stock buyback are being set against the potential threat from robo-taxi services.  Uber forecast gross bookings of $48.25 billion to $49.75 billion for the third quarter, ahead of Wall Street’s projected $47.5 billion.

headline: Uber Stock Rises On Q2 Sales Beat, $20 Billion Buyback Plan
summary: Uber Technologies stock wavered early Wednesday after the company met second-quarter earnings forecasts and topped on revenue.  The ride-hailing and food-delivery giant also said it was authorizing a $20 billion stock buyback plan.  Uber said it earned an adjusted 63 cents per share for the June-ended quarter, up 34% from a year earlier.

headline: Uber bets on loyalty program to drive growth, unveils $20 billion buyback plan
summary: The company said members for its $9.99 "Uber One" program jumped 60% in June to more than 36 million from a year earlier, and more than one-third of its bookings were coming from them.  These users are crucial for Uber as they engage with both its services, generating more than three times the profit compared to that from users who use just one service.  To draw more people to the loyalty program, Uber held a week-long event in May that offered discounts and deals across rides, food delivery and groceries.

raw.headline: Uber bets on loyalty program to drive growth, unveils $20 billion buyback plan
raw.summary: The company said members for its $9.99 "Uber One" program jumped 60% in June to more than 36 million from a year earlier, and more than one-third of its bookings were coming from them.  These users are crucial for Uber as they engage with both its services, generating more than three times the profit compared to that from users who use just one service.  To draw more people to the loyalty program, Uber held a week-long event in May that offered discounts and deals across rides, food delivery and groceries.

headline: S&P 500, Dow futures buoyed by earnings, Fed rate cut hopes
summary: (Reuters) -S&P 500 and Dow futures climbed on Wednesday, as investors assessed a fresh round of corporate earnings, while renewed optimism that the Federal Reserve will soon deliver long-awaited interest rate cuts kept markets buoyant.  Adding to the uncertainty, Trump will decide on a nominee to replace outgoing Fed Governor Adriana Kugler by the end of the week, while saying he narrowed the possible replacements for Fed Chair Jerome Powell to a short list of four.

raw.headline: S&P 500, Dow futures buoyed by earnings, Fed rate cut hopes
raw.summary: (Reuters) -S&P 500 and Dow futures climbed on Wednesday, as investors assessed a fresh round of corporate earnings, while renewed optimism that the Federal Reserve will soon deliver long-awaited interest rate cuts kept markets buoyant.  Adding to the uncertainty, Trump will decide on a nominee to replace outgoing Fed Governor Adriana Kugler by the end of the week, while saying he narrowed the possible replacements for Fed Chair Jerome Powell to a short list of four.

headline: NYC Landlord Says Tenants Owed $70K, Trashed Her Home, and Left an 'Unbearable' Stench — It Took 2 Years to Evict and They Faced No Consequences
summary: Some people dream of passive income. Others just want to survive renting out a house without needing a gas mask. Real estate might be passive, but it's definitely not effortless — and for one New York City landlord, it was anything but profitable. Posting in the Landlord subreddit, a woman shared how her supposedly "perfect" tenants turned her newly purchased home into a two-year legal nightmare. She had relied on a trusted local real estate agent who vouched for two women—clean background check

headline: $20M From One Stock? Graham Stephan Warns Against Betting It All Like This Investor Did
summary: Investing in the right stock at the right time can result in substantial returns. One investor managed to turn a $300,000 investment in Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) into more than $20 million after a few years. Even though it turned out well for the investor, it's risky to put all of your eggs in one basket.
